result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.  vp
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 10, 2015 received and filed. tk
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($2,500.00) ad
State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Deputy Court Clerk: TMK
 Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered any cash bail on deposit forfeited.  The Court ordered a Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 3, 2015 received and filed. tk

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: Missed office Contact, received and filed. tk 
Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Avelino Gutierrez in court with attorney Julius Andriusis via telephone.  Brandon Wigely for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case previously calendared off the record to track with co-defendant, and to allow the Defense additional time to review discovery with the Defendant. Case called on the record to allow the Spanish Interpreter to appear with the Defendant. Defense counsel did not wish to appear via telephone for the scheduling on the record. Case is adjourned for projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-4-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justisce Point Pretrial Report dated May 5, 2015, received and filed.

15RM022003  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/23/2015

Defendant Avelino Gutierrez in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Ron Dague for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and  to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Avelino Gutierrez in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Avelino Gutierrez in custody.  
Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Intepreter sworn: Alexandria Wirth.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
